com.squareup.picasso3

Class Picasso

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.squareup.picasso3.Picasso

  • public class Picasso
extends java.lang.Object
    Image downloading, transformation, and caching manager.

    Use PicassoProvider#get() for a global singleton instance or construct your own instance with Picasso.Builder.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Picasso.Builder
      Fluent API for creating Picasso instances.
      static interface  Picasso.Listener
      Callbacks for Picasso events.
      static class  Picasso.LoadedFrom
      Describes where the image was loaded from.
      static class  Picasso.Priority
      The priority of a request.
      static interface  Picasso.RequestTransformer
      A transformer that is called immediately before every request is submitted.

      • cancelTag

        public void cancelTag(java.lang.Object tag)
        Cancel any existing requests with given tag. You can set a tag on new requests with RequestCreator.tag(Object).
        See Also:
        RequestCreator.tag(Object)

      • pauseTag

        public void pauseTag(java.lang.Object tag)
        Pause existing requests with the given tag. Use resumeTag(Object) to resume requests with the given tag.
        See Also:
        resumeTag(Object), RequestCreator.tag(Object)

      • resumeTag

        public void resumeTag(java.lang.Object tag)
        Resume paused requests with the given tag. Use pauseTag(Object) to pause requests with the given tag.
        See Also:
        pauseTag(Object), RequestCreator.tag(Object)

      • load

        public RequestCreator load(android.net.Uri uri)
        Start an image request using the specified URI.

        Passing null as a uri will not trigger any request but will set a placeholder, if one is specified.

        See Also:
        load(File), load(String), load(int)

      • load

        public RequestCreator load(java.lang.String path)
        Start an image request using the specified path. This is a convenience method for calling load(Uri).

        This path may be a remote URL, file resource (prefixed with file:), content resource (prefixed with content:), or android resource (prefixed with android.resource:.

        Passing null as a path will not trigger any request but will set a placeholder, if one is specified.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if path is empty or blank string.
        See Also:
        load(Uri), load(File), load(int)

      • load

        public RequestCreator load(java.io.File file)
        Start an image request using the specified image file. This is a convenience method for calling load(Uri).

        Passing null as a file will not trigger any request but will set a placeholder, if one is specified.

        Equivalent to calling load(Uri.fromFile(file)).

        See Also:
        load(Uri), load(String), load(int)

      • load

        public RequestCreator load(int resourceId)
        Start an image request using the specified drawable resource ID.
        See Also:
        load(Uri), load(String), load(File)

      • evictAll

        public void evictAll()
        Clear all the bitmaps from the memory cache.

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(android.net.Uri uri)
        Invalidate all memory cached images for the specified uri.
        See Also:
        invalidate(String), invalidate(File)

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(java.lang.String path)
        Invalidate all memory cached images for the specified path. You can also pass a stable key.
        See Also:
        invalidate(Uri), invalidate(File)

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(java.io.File file)
        Invalidate all memory cached images for the specified file.
        See Also:
        invalidate(Uri), invalidate(String)

      • setIndicatorsEnabled

        public void setIndicatorsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Toggle whether to display debug indicators on images.

      • getIndicatorsEnabled

        public boolean getIndicatorsEnabled()
        true if debug indicators should are displayed on images.

      • setLoggingEnabled

        public void setLoggingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Toggle whether debug logging is enabled.

        WARNING: Enabling this will result in excessive object allocation. This should be only be used for debugging Picasso behavior. Do NOT pass BuildConfig.DEBUG.

      • isLoggingEnabled

        public boolean isLoggingEnabled()
        true if debug logging is enabled.

      • getSnapshot

        public StatsSnapshot getSnapshot()
        Creates a StatsSnapshot of the current stats for this instance.

        NOTE: The snapshot may not always be completely up-to-date if requests are still in progress.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Stops this instance from accepting further requests.
